intro: Eleocharis galapagensis, commonly known as the Galápagos sedge, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. This species typically grows in moist, coastal habitats such as sand dunes and rocky shores. Its morphology includes grass-like leaves and small, clustered spikelets that produce wind-pollinated flowers. Eleocharis galapagensis plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for local wildlife.
